title.justification: The research paper extensively covers methods, datasets, and experiments for predicting the political affiliation of Twitter users.

extractions.description: This research paper provides a comprehensive survey and empirical comparison of current practices for predicting political party affiliation of Twitter users. It proposes new methods that are competitive with state-of-the-art techniques while requiring fewer computational resources. The study covers various data types such as tweet text, user relations, and interactions to compare their effectiveness for the task. Extensive experiments are conducted to measure accuracy, coverage, and cost to provide insights for both practical applications and further research.

type.justification: The paper conducts extensive experiments to evaluate different methods for a practical task, providing thorough empirical insights.
type.quote: In this paper, we provide a comprehensive survey and an empirical comparison of the current party prediction practices and propose several new approaches which are competitive with or outperform state-of-the-art methods, yet require less computational resources.

name.justification: The research focuses on analyzing and processing text data from Twitter to predict political party affiliation, which is a central task in Natural Language Processing.
name.quote: Party prediction models rely on the content generated by the users (e.g., tweet texts)...

name.justification: The paper deals with analyzing user behavior and interactions on the social media platform Twitter for political party prediction.
name.quote: A large number of studies on social media compare the behaviour of users from different political parties... Inferring the political orientation of social media users is a common first step in a wide range of studies.

name.justification: The research makes extensive use of graph neural networks to model relations and interactions between Twitter users for predicting political affiliations.
name.quote: We also propose our own approaches based on label propagation, GCN (Graph Convolutional Networks), GAT (Graph Attention Networks), HAN (Heterogeneous Graph Attention Networks)...

name.justification: The GCN model is one of the approaches proposed and tested in the paper for predicting political affiliations.
name.quote: We also propose our own approaches based on label propagation, GCN (Graph Convolutional Networks), GAT (Graph Attention Networks), HAN (Heterogeneous Graph Attention Networks)...

is_contributed.justification: The GCN model is proposed and its implementation detailed within the research paper.
is_contributed.quote: We also propose our own approaches based on label propagation, GCN (Graph Convolutional Networks)...

is_executed.justification: The GCN model is executed as part of the extensive experiments conducted in the paper.
is_executed.quote: We generally use a single-layer version that is semi-supervised, with an unsupervised link prediction task and a supervised node classification task using profile classifier labels on training nodes.

is_compared.justification: The performance of the GCN model is compared with other state-of-the-art methods in the experiments.
is_compared.quote: From the results reported in Table 4, we draw three main conclusions: 1. Testing different approaches on the same users, like here, is necessary for clear comparisons.

referenced_paper_title.value: Semi-Supervised Classification with Graph Convolutional Networks
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper provides the foundation upon which the presented GCN model is based.
referenced_paper_title.quote: GCN Our next step here is to construct one embedding per user and interaction type—i.e., a learned vector representing each user’s realized interactions of that type (e.g., retweet, followership). We use the titular GCN (Kipf and Welling 2017), which is a simple yet powerful graph representation learning model.

name.justification: The GAT model is one of the approaches proposed and tested in the paper for predicting political affiliations.
name.quote: We also propose our own approaches based on label propagation, GCN (Graph Convolutional Networks), GAT (Graph Attention Networks)...

is_contributed.justification: The GAT model is proposed and its implementation detailed within the research paper.
is_contributed.quote: We also propose our own approaches based on label propagation, ... GAT (Graph Attention Networks)...

is_executed.justification: The GAT model is executed as part of the extensive experiments conducted in the paper.
is_executed.quote: Our usage of GAT is similar to GCN, except we only use node classification (no link prediction) to train it. We follow the architecture and implementation of Huang et al. (2020).

is_compared.justification: The performance of the GAT model is compared with other state-of-the-art methods in the experiments.
is_compared.quote: From the results reported in Table 4, we draw three main conclusions: 1. Testing different approaches on the same users, like here, is necessary for clear comparisons.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper provides the foundation upon which the presented GAT model is based.
referenced_paper_title.quote: GAT Our usage of GAT is similar to GCN, except we only use node classification (no link prediction) to train it. We follow the architecture and implementation of Huang et al. (2020).

name.justification: The HAN model is one of the approaches proposed and tested in the paper for predicting political affiliations.
name.quote: We also propose our own approaches based on label propagation, ... HAN (Heterogeneous Graph Attention Networks)...

is_contributed.justification: The HAN model is proposed and its implementation detailed within the research paper.
is_contributed.quote: We also propose our own approaches based on ... HAN (Heterogeneous Graph Attention Networks)...

is_executed.justification: The HAN model is executed as part of the extensive experiments conducted in the paper.
is_executed.quote: Our implementation of HAN is similar to GAT, but here we combine multiple graph types into a heterogeneous graph... We use the Deep Graph Library (DGL) implementation of HAN...

is_compared.justification: The performance of the HAN model is compared with other state-of-the-art methods in the experiments.
is_compared.quote: We also propose our own approaches... and show that these methods deliver strong performance and can do so from a wide variety of data types.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper provides the foundation upon which the presented HAN model is based.
referenced_paper_title.quote: HAN Our implementation of HAN is similar to GAT, but here we combine multiple graph types into a heterogeneous graph... We use the Deep Graph Library (DGL) implementation of HAN which in turn is based on the original from Wang et al. (2019b).

name.justification: This dataset contains tweets from around 14,000 Twitter users who discuss American politics during the period around the 2020 US election.
name.quote: In order to conduct this analysis, we collected a rich dataset of approximately 14,000 Twitter users who discuss American politics during the time period directly before and after the 2020 US election.

referenced_paper_title.justification: No specific paper is referenced for this dataset since it appears to have been collected specifically for this study.

name.justification: This dataset includes tweets, retweets, and replies from 995 public and personal Twitter accounts of the United States representatives, senators, and candidates.
name.quote: Politicians Data We collected all tweets, retweets and replies from 995 public and personal Twitter accounts of the United States representatives (433), senators (99), as well as vice presidential and presidential candidates (8) using Twitter’s Search API.

referenced_paper_title.justification: No specific paper is referenced for this dataset since it appears to have been collected specifically for this study.

name.justification: This dataset contains tweets from around 1.1 million users discussing the 2021 Canadian election.
name.quote: Canadian Public Data We also collected data on discussion of the 2021 Canadian election, from 2021-07-31 to 2021-10-21.

referenced_paper_title.justification: No specific paper is referenced for this dataset since it appears to have been collected specifically for this study.

name.justification: This library is used to implement the HAN model for party prediction.
name.quote: We use the Deep Graph Library (DGL) implementation of HAN which in turn is based on the original from Wang et al. (2019b).

referenced_paper_title.value: Deep Graph Library: A Graph-Centric, Highly-Performant Package for Graph Neural Networks
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper describes the Deep Graph Library, which is used in the implementation of the HAN model.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We use the Deep Graph Library (DGL) implementation of HAN which in turn is based on the original from Wang et al. (2019b).

name.justification: This library is used for implementing transformer-based language models such as RoBERTa in the paper.
name.quote: We also used the HuggingFace transformer library for implementing text-based models like RoBERTa.

referenced_paper_title.value: HuggingFace’s Transformers: State-of-the-art Natural Language Processing
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper describes the HuggingFace Transformers library, which is used in the implementation of transformer-based models like RoBERTa in the study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We also used the HuggingFace transformer library for implementing text-based models like RoBERTa.
